meanings.definition: A set that contains all the elements of another set, and possibly additional elements.
meanings.sent1: In math class, we learned that a superset includes all the items from another set.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store had a superset of fruits, including apples, bananas, and oranges.
meanings.sent3: I asked for a superset of toppings on my pizza, and they added extra cheese and mushrooms!
meanings.sent4: Her book collection was a superset of mine, with many more novels and genres.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was a superset of jewels, with rubies, diamonds, and emeralds sparkling inside.

meanings.definition: A set that is a subset of another set.
meanings.sent1: The red fruits were a superset of the fruits in the basket.
meanings.sent2: She selected a superset of colors for her painting, including blue, green, and yellow.
meanings.sent3: The superset of animals in the zoo included lions, tigers, and bears - oh my!
meanings.sent4: His collection of stamps was a superset of mine, with rare and unique designs.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a superset of flowers, with roses, daisies, and tulips blooming beautifully.
